activities.loc: Br 3 - Law Enforcement Center - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt:
9:00 AM Defendant Billie J Lacy in court.  Attorney William Demet for Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels in court for Billie J Lacy.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob Nelson Garman in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a status. 
Defense indicates they have not received an offer from the State and are interested in hearing what it is. 
State puts the offer on the record. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report
DA Authorization to Defense to Obtain Copies of Certain Evidence

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with Walmart Stores

1:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelly Larsen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Billie J Lacy appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson appeared by video for Billie J Lacy. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defense moves to dismiss count 2 with argument 
State objects with argument.
BTC: Motion to dismiss count 2 granted. Count 2 dismissed without prejudice. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on September 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Initial appearance on July 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
